title: Gillman Barracks
description: Contemporary art compound housed within a preserved colonial barracks - the architecture sets the tone for a day spent browsing the gallery spaces.  There are refreshment and dining venues on-site too.

title: Cafe du Nord
description: Former speakeasy converted into an intimate performance venue.  Keep tabs on the venue's event calendar.  Arrive early to grab some pre-show drinks and get a spot near the front - the place fills up quickly.

title: Biererei
description: Beer bar with a huge selection of taps (even IPAs!) on Oranienstrasse.  Friendly and knowledgeable owner with additional curbside seating.

title: Kama Sushi
description: Relaxed sushi spot in Noe Valley.  A more affordable option than others in the Bay Area.  Offers a full menu of rolls, sashimi, donburi, and ramen.  Visit during happy hour for big portions at even more reasonable prices.

title: Sturehof
description: This old-school fine-dining restaurant has been in Stockholm for so long that it has become an institution.  Expect plenty of seafood options, a great patio for nice weather, and traditional Swedish dishes.

title: Neue Maxburg
description: After being almost destroyed during the war, the Maxburg was rebuilt in the 1950s in the Bauhaus style, resulting to this successful ensemble and a peaceful oasis in the city center after restoration.

title: PKM Gallery
description: Showcasing contemporary art since it opened in 2001. The gallery displays works of Korean and international artists who reflect current trends in art.

title: Prinzipal Kreuzberg
description: Live burlesque shows most nights.  Friendly bartenders, excellent cocktails, fresh ingredients.

title: The Independent
description: Small concert venue near the University of San Francisco providing an intimate show experience.  The events calendar is always stellar, whether it's established indie bands or emerging artists.  Offers a full bar for thirsty attendees.

title: Soulpepper Theatre Company
description: This independent not-for-profit arts center is housed within a former distillery.  Focus is placed on youth productions and training - turning an evening's entertainment into a worthwhile cause.

title: The Warfield
description: One of San Francisco's more historic theatre venues, The Warfield opened its doors in 1922 with a focus on vaudeville.  There isn't a bad seat in the house, with plenty of bars to grab drinks at.

title: Stubb's Bar-B-Q
description: Equal parts barbecue restaurant and live music venue - perhaps more famous for the latter.  Stubb's serves the usual roster of brisket, ribs, and cold beer.  The venue is also renowned for its Sunday Gospel Brunch.  Eat and revel.

title: Funkhaus Berlin
description: Entertainment venue in a former GDR broadcasting complex.  This all-in-one facility offers restaurants, music studios, event spaces, and a concert hall.   Tour the location by day and attend a show in the evening.

title: Ocean Beach, San Diego
description: Ocean beach is a seafront neighborhood with relaxed SoCal vibes.  Beaches are often filled with sunbathers and surfers.  Meanwhile, the pier offers a fishing spot with unrivaled views.  Ample eateries and shops throughout.

title: Blu Jaz
description: Those looking for a fun venue: don't overlook this colorful caf√©-bar on Bali Lane.  Open during the day, but comes alive after the sun sets.  There is almost always an event happening: from live music, to comedy nights and poetry readings.

title: Hangzhou
description: The capital of Zhejiang province, Hangzhou lies at the southernmost end of China's famous Grand Canal.  Local highlights include the famous bridges of West Lake and the Yue Fei Temple.  The city is also renowned for its historic silk trade.

title: Moderna Museet
description: Moderna Museet is a large museum showcasing a collection of over 130,000 pieces of artwork - from contemporary and modern art to photography.  This extensive portfolio allows the museum to circulate its exhibits.

title: Freisinger Hof
description: Upscale hotel in a Bavarian-style building from the 1870s, overlooking Englischer Garten park. Features traditional rooms, a restaurant specializing in Austrian and South German cuisine, a beer garden, and fitness amenities.

title: Le Procope
description: The oldest restaurant in Paris serving traditional French cuisine.  The beauty is in the ambiance, building, and historic artifacts (Napoleon, Ben Franklin, and more).  Can attract a tourist crowd.

title: Emmy's Spaghetti Shack
description: Casual Italian eatery with a big personality.  Pasta is king here, as the name would suggest.  Super down-to-earth, vibrant decor, friendly staff, and good cocktails.  A popular and reliable option on Mission Street.

title: G√°vea Antiques Fair
description: A Sunday fair exhibiting a range of antique wares.  Locals trade everything from books, paintings, vinyl, clothes, to crockery and carpets.  A lively event to explore, and to find a unique keepsake.

title: Asian Civilisations Museum
description: Singapore has a rich history as a port city, facilitating trade throughout Asia.  This museum honors that past, with exhibits and artefacts from all over the continent showing how societies have interacted and connected.

title: Almanegra Caf√©
description: Loosely translated as "Blacksoul", Almanegra may be small in size, but they know how to make a coffee - be it a flat white, cold brew, or slow-drip.  Best enjoyed as pick-up to enjoy on the sidewalk.  The caf√© also offers a small food menu.

title: Jupiter Disco
description: Neon-drenched speakeasy meets outer space.  Come for the retro, sci-fi vibe, and stay for the dance parties, creative drinks, and solid sound system.  A smaller venue with a proven atmosphere.

title: Regensburg
description: River city iconic for its twin-spired cathedral, stone bridges, and well-preserved architecture.  Regensburg's medieval center was designated a UNESCO Heritage Site in 2006.  One of the most popular destinations in Germany.

title: Gero Rio
description: Gero Rio, part of the Fasano Hotel complex, is located at Ipanema, Rio de Janeiro.  This elegant restaurant specializes in serving up modern interpretations of Italian cuisine in a tastefully decorated setting.

title: Villon
description: Classic-style venue within the Proper Hotel that wear many hats - breakfast, lunch, dinner, cocktails, and afternoon tea.  All menus have sophisticated takes on New American cuisine.  The cocktails are also fresh takes on classics.

title: Coal Office Restaurant
description: Interior design meets culinary experience.  The brainchild of a chef and a designer, Coal Office is a modern Middle Eastern restaurant anchored by a rustic-chic aesthetic.  Visit for food and admire the setting - a dual-threat space.

title: Daphne‚Äôs
description: Italian cuisine served in a well-to-do setting.  Daphne‚Äôs is a neighborhood staple and is open for lunch and dinner.  If visiting during the day, request a table in the bright and airy conservatory.  A refined option.

title: Rocco
description: Italian flavors meet Portuguese cuisine.  Located within the new Ivens Hotel.  Rocco's interiors are theatric, from the stylish bar to the flower-print stools and bottle-lined walls.  Also, spend time in the accompanying drinks lounge.

title: Circolo Popolare
description: Italian eatery defined by opulence and glam.  The atmosphere is lively and the portions are generous.  Visit early or make a reservation - the venue is highly popular from opening until close.

title: Devil's Teeth Baking Company
description: Two words: breakfast sandwiches.  Lines form at both San Fransisco locations for stuffed buttermilk biscuits, fresh sourdough, and fried beignets.  Sunset Roasters coffee is served too.  Arrive early and hungry.

title: Barrio Logan
description: Artsy meets industrial in this colorful neighborhood, which is historically home to San Diego's Mexican and Chicano communities.  World-class murals are everywhere, as well as a host of local breweries and Chicano comfort food.

title: Dar Rhizlane
description: Fine dining within the hotel of the same name.  A traditional Moroccan menu is accented by dishes with more experimental flavor palates - the sea-bream tagine is a stand out.  Dine in the courtyard surrounded by orange trees and flowers.

title: Karl-Marx-Allee
description: In Berlin's Friedrichshain and Mitte, Karl-Marx-Allee is a monumental socialist boulevard built by the German Democratic Republic.  It runs from Alexanderplatz to the Frankfurter Tor.  Today, the boulevard is named after Karl Marx.

title: Cafe Zoetrope
description: Cozy Italian eatery housed within the iconic Colombus Tower - a San Francisco landmark.  Visit hungry and dine on pizza and pasta, or refresh with a coffee or Aperol spritz.  Sit inside or beneath the streetside awning.

title: Gasthof Georg Wallner
description: Traditional inn located in the Austrian countryside. Offers rustic rooms, a restaurant serving local cuisine, and scenic views of the surrounding mountains.

title: Miradouro de S√£o Pedro de Alc√¢ntara
description: Landscaped terrace with panoramic views of the city.  Visit for new perspectives of Lisbon's landmarks - from St. George's Castle to the Carmo Convent.  The lower geometric garden contains busts of Greek and Roman mythological figures.

title: Sud 777
description: Led by chef Edgar Nu√±ez, Sud 777 cooks fresh Mexican cuisine made with local produce and ingredients - the tasting menu changes according to the seasons. Make sure to reserve ahead of time.

title: Indio Studios
description: Indio Studios is a small movie theater that champions indie and global features.  The venue also boasts an adjoining eatery that serves Japanese food with Peruvian influences.  Come for the arthouse films, linger for the food and drink.

title: Ankerklause
description: Popular canalside bar with a terrace and lively vibe.  This small bar has a ship interior design and is a canal-side favorite for both Kreuzberg locals and tourists alike.

title: Coronado
description: A popular resort city on its own peninsula in San Diego Bay, easily accessed by foot, ferry, or car.  Coronado offers something for all - from eateries and bars to golf courses and a dog beach.  An easy day trip from San Diego.

title: Daniel Faria Gallery
description: A veteran of the Toronto art scene for more than 10 years ‚Äì Daniel Faria opened the doors to his namesake gallery in 2011.  The contemporary exhibition space takes time to spotlight individual creators - both Canadian and international.

title: Mount Hood
description: A dormant volcano üåã covered in snow that makes for great ski trips, climbing, and hiking üèîÔ∏è.  One of the most prominent views from Portland.  Serious skiers can choose from six ski areas, including Timberline and Meadows.

title: La Valise
description: Tucked in a restored 1920s townhouse, La Valise offers boutique luxury.  Each of the eight suites is furnished with vintage items sourced from across the country.  The downstairs French cafe serves all-day breakfast and lunch.

title: Bar Mural
description: Cozy wine bar in Munich with an industrial vibe, offering small plates and mains like beef tartar. Features a selection of natural wines, cocktails, and a lively atmosphere with 80's disco music.

title: Mercado Little Spain
description: Lively food hall offering a taste of Spanish fare, with wood-fired paella and churros as highlights. Authentic flavors shine in expertly prepared dishes.

title: Bel√©m Tower
description: UNESCO World Heritage Site on the banks of the Tagus.  Built during the Portuguese Renaissance, the four-story tower is often described as a symbol of Europe's Age of Discoveries.  A spotlight for Manueline architectural design.

title: Wright Bros. Brew And Brew
description: Multipurpose venue serving coffee, craft brews, sandwiches, and other light meals.  The mixed-concept bar has become an all-day space for the local community - it's open from seven in the morning until late.

title: Foreign Cinema
description: Step inside this unconventional restaurant where the menu changes every day and so does the movie that plays... talk about dinner and a show!  It can book up quick so try to get reservations in advance.

title: Bar 878
description: Former speakeasy brimming with character, without being too over-the-top.  A place to enjoy with friends.  Visit soon after opening to sample their menu, and then stay into the early hours with drinks in hand.

title: Encinitas
description: Recently awarded as one of the top 20 surf towns in the world.  Beaches aside, Encinitas' downtown area is a well-established mix of surf stores, seafood restaurants, and coffee shops.  The locale also harbors the San Diego Botanic Garden.

title: Mamecha
description: Japanese matcha caf√© serving a mix of savory and sweet fare.  Not exclusive to its green tea theme, patrons can enjoy onigiri and bento boxes before indulging in mochi and cheesecake.  Also offers the usual roster of coffees and tea.

title: A4 Arts Foundation
description: Though officially a gallery,  A4 Arts more so considers itself a space for experimentation.  With a focus on contemporary art, its three floors include an exhibition space, library, and a studio for residencies.

title: The Plaza
description: Operating under the Marriott umbrella.  This five-star hotel's main selling point is its central location.  Other highlights include modern rooms with views, four restaurants, and a swimming pool.  A proven, if uninspiring, experience.

title: S. H. Ervin Gallery
description: The S. H. Ervin Gallery focuses on historical and contemporary Australian art, all housed within a 19th-century National Trust building.  With a collection of over 450 pieces, there is plenty of domestic artwork to discover.

title: Benu
description: Highbrow restaurant with three Michelin stars serving Asian-inspired dishes.  The tasting menu features a variety of seafood, meats, and vegetables - at $375, it's an expensive but celebrated experience.  A headline dining venue.

title: Quasi Quasi
description: One of these classic restaurant-in-a-living-room Neuk√∂lln spots, but wow is the food worth coming here for.  The menu appears simple but everything is fresh, delicious, and made with heart.  Super friendly staff as well.

title: Bar Douro
description: Representing Portuguese wine and cuisine in London.  Bar Douro's London Bridge location - another  in Finsbury - is set within a railway arch and offers indoor-outdoor dining.  Order a mix of small plates to share around the table.

title: Bistrotheque
description: Sophisticated dining in a converted factory space - the whitewashed walls make for an industrial-chic atmosphere.  The French-influenced menu has plenty of variety and focuses on simple flavors done well.  Weekend brunches are popular.

title: Cafe Boheme
description: Classic French bistro in the middle of London's West End.  Food is served throughout the day - from casual breakfasts and brunches to more formal dinners.  Evening jazz performances create a great pre-theatre atmosphere.

title: Fujimaru Wineshop & Diner
description: What it says on the tin - a wine shop on the first floor and a restaurant on the second.  Guests can select a bottle of wine from the extensive range downstairs and carry it up to have with their meal.

title: Prado
description: Restaurant characterized by soaring ceilings and an industrial-chic aesthetic.  Settled in a former fish factory, Prado provides a farm-to-table experience; with goat's cheese, fried bread, Iberico pork, and organic wine.

title: Reyna on King
description: Self-described as the "cool kid‚Äù - this Mediterranean restaurant focuses hard on atmosphere and ambiance.  Settle in under the faux hanging garden ceiling for some tapas while throwing back a cocktail or two.

title: Le Rubis
description: Cozy bistro with a retro feel and a sidewalk terrace.  Le Rubis serves traditional French dishes with a focus on seasonal ingredients - take advantage of the natural wine selection too.  Dine alfresco when the weather allows.

title: Taberna Anti Dantas
description: Lively tavern with vintage, rustic interiors.  Come for seafood favorites, such as tuna steak, fried octopus, codfish cakes, and fish soup served in a bread bowl.  Try a shot of local port wine in a chocolate cup for dessert.

title: Fandi Mata
description: Mediterranean-influenced menu in an industrial colorful space. There's a large bar downstairs and a six-seat mezcal bar on the mezzanine. DJs start spinning at 8 pm so you can dance after dinner.

title: Tasca Kome
description: Izakaya-style tasca by Japanese expat Yuko Yamamoto serving homestyle cuisine made using local, organic vegetables and fish from the Azores.  Find staples such as salmon sashimi, tonkatsu, and craft beer.

title: Underbelly
description: Japanese noodle house serving up craft beer and cocktails.  Expect a trendy crowd slurping ramen and eating buns in the neon light of this recently remodeled bar.

title: Wvrst
description: A homage to Oktoberfest, this Bavarian-inspired beer hall is the destination for artisan sausages and a  stein of craft beer.  Descend upon either of their city center locations for a social dinner and drink.  A community atmosphere.

title: The Lady Ottoline
description: Elevated gastropub serving a variety of gins, craft beers, and a rotational menu of British cuisine.  The Lady Ottoline is as equally suited to a composed meal as it is an evening of drinks and conversation.  Visit for both.

title: El Burro
description: From the founders of the legendary Royale Eatery, El Burro serves up delectable Mexican fare amidst bright, vibrant decor.  Pair any of the imaginative tacos üåÆ with a local craft beer or tequila.

title: Spruce
description: Upscale spot for high-end food lovers.  One Michelin star earned by focusing on local ingredients.  Try and sit at the bar if you can.

title: Le Trou Au Mur
description: Stylish restaurant in Medina with a chic interior and a rooftop terrace - book ahead to secure a table for sunset.  Le Trou Au Mur serves some international cuisine but is renowned for its Moroccan dishes, especially the Meshoui lamb.

title: Cole's
description: Landmark saloon-style restaurant known for its 100-year-old french dip sandwiches.  It's still hard to say whether the food or the drink is the biggest draw.  Enjoy premium spirits and drafts in the backroom speakeasy.

title: Le Crocodile
description: Laidback French brasserie located at the Wythe Hotel.  The protocol here is weekday dinners and weekend brunches.  The roast chicken is a menu standout, but it's hard to choose wrong.  Make sure to visit with space for three courses.

title: Mr. Wong
description: Mr. Wong, within the Establishment Hotel, specializes in modern Cantonese food.  The lunch menu features a dim sum option, while the a la carte menu hosts a number of familiar and unfamiliar favorites.  The barbecue duck is popular.

title: Gastrologik
description: Gastrologik has been awarded two Michelin stars, is certified organic, and is also committed to exclusively using Swedish produce.  As such, the menu changes daily.  For a true Swedish experience, opt for the Nordic beverage pairing.

title: Mikla
description: Rooftop terrace restaurant led by the renowned chef, Mehmet Gurs.  Try the traditional city specialties like crispy balik ekmek and sutlac, or go for their gin and tonic to cap the night off.

title: La Grande Table Marocaine
description: Opulent restaurant of the Royal Mansour Hotel.  Offers a menu of classic Moroccan dishes, like seafood pastilla and seven-vegetable couscous.  The restaurant's traditional oud players create a multi-sense experience - both taste and sound.

title: The Conservatory Restaurant
description: Fine dining in the elegant conservatory of five-star hotel, The Cellars-Hohenort.  The restaurant's chef has created classic daily menus that draw influence from the surrounding area.  The afternoon tea is also amongst the best in the city.

title: Pizzeria Libretto
description: A reliable, city-wide Neapolitan pizzeria offering dine-in and take-out options.  The restaurant focuses on local ingredients and simple cooking methods.  The extensive menu also provides ample choices for vegans and gluten-free diners.

title: Eins44
description: Inventive plates with familiar ingredients and textures presented in a contemporary manner.  Located in a modernized former distillery.

title: Nae:um
description: Michelin-starred Korean fine dining with a modern twist on traditional flavors, featuring signature dishes like somyeon, galbi, and grouper, in addition to  buckwheat noodles.

title: Firenze By Night
description: Old school Italian restaurant serving the usual ensemble of antipasti, pasta, grilled meats, and fish.  The signature gnocchi is a solid foundation for any order.  Family-run and a North Beach staple.

title: Farmhouse Kitchen Thai Cuisine
description: Colorful Thai restaurant with colorful food to match.  Serves street food classics and elevated interpretations of other staples - pad thai, curries, noodles, and so on.  Visit any one of the three locations throughout the Bay Area.

title: Cevicheria
description: Nice little spot for a daily changing assortment of fresh ceviche and pisco sours.  Dresdener Strasse is a hidden gem in Kreuzberg with plentiful after dinner drink spots to visit as well (W√ºrgeengel, Ottorink Weinbar, Tr√∂dler).

title: Trattoria de la Trebia
description: Trattoria de la Trebia serves a plethora of classic Italian cuisine - though, its grilled meats menu and extensive wine collection are often the reason for return visits.  Detour via both the restaurant's wine cellar and meat display.

title: Arkhe
description: Elevated vegetarian fare from a Portuguese-Brazilian chef trained in French and Italian cuisine.  Choose from three, five, or seven courses.  Visitors can also ask for vegan options and wine pairings, should they so wish.

title: Nage & Sauge
description: Restro-bar in the middle of Munich serving large salads and daily-changing pasta dishes.  Traditional wood seating fills the dimly lit tavern and outdoor seating makes it an ideal venue on summer days.  Good food, good drinks.

title: Mano Rota
description: Peruvian and Japanese fusion restaurant with industrial-chic vibes.  The seasonal tasting menu is highly recommended - Mano Rota is also happy to accommodate dietary needs and preferences.  Enjoy wines alongside.

title: Steirereck
description: Riverside fine-dining in Stadtpark.  Steirereck boasts two Michelin stars, a chic restaurant design, creative cuisine, and outstanding service.  All dishes from Head Chef Heinz Reitbauer are inventive and worth trying.

title: IPPUDO
description: American iteration of the renowned international ramen kitchen.  The bad news is that everyone and their mother knows this place and so queues are standard.  The good news is that the food served makes the wait worthwhile.

title: Causwells
description: Neighborhood American bistro with an award-winning cheeseburger - the "Americana."  The crispy chicken sandwich is another standout.  The menu, as a whole, spotlights local, seasonal ingredients.  Friendly service and reliable food.

title: Pine & Crane
description: The greatest hits of Taiwanese cooking in a hip corner of LA's Silver Lake.

title: Bavel
description: From the founders of Bestia, restaurant Bavel serves Israeli and Middle Eastern cuisine in Downtown LA's Arts District.

title: Cuisine of Nepal
description: Hearty spread of Nepalese and Indian food with a few Tibetan dishes sprinkled in.  Visit hungry and order a surplus.  The staff are super friendly and are happy to offer recommendations based on taste preferences.

title: Rebel Asian
description: Pan-Asian restaurant offering bao buns, nasi goreng, noodles, and spring rolls - all with a twist.  Don't skip the cocktails either.  The space itself boasts a hip, neon-infused aesthetic.

title: By Koji
description: Created by renowned chef Koji Yokomizo, the Santos neighborhood installation follows the success of two branches in S√£o Paulo.  With its sleek interiors and lengthy menu, by Koji is considered one of the best sushi restaurants in Lisbon.

title: Sacramento do Chiado
description: Mediterranean and Portuguese cuisine in an intimate setting near the Carmo Convent ruins.  Entr√©e highlights include curried duck, grilled octopus, and queijada.  The restaurant has an alfresco terrace for hot days.

title: Restaurante Zanzibar
description: Bright restaurant serving Portuguese cuisine, including cozido √† Portuguesa on Sundays - a traditional mixed meat boil.  The airy setting also includes a terrace overlooking the river.  Vegetarian options are available.

title: Kefi Greek Bistro
description: Greek fare in a stylish spot near Compo do Ourique.  Expect traditional menu staples including a must-try moussaka and a stellar wine list.  Best to order as many dishes as possible and share them with friends.  Be prepared for queues.

title: Clandestino
description: Part of Lisbon's underground food network and one of many clandestine Chinese restaurants (hence the name).  Tucked inside an unassuming apartment building.  Portions are big and reasonably priced.  Unpretentious dining.

title: RASA
description: Sister restaurant to "SARA".  RASA seems to have hit a good tone with its global culinary experience - there's something for everyone on the menu.  All served in an industrial-chic space with a well-stocked bar.

title: SARA
description: Dining concept serving global cuisine in a clean and minimalist space.  Sharing is recommended but half portions are available for solo diners - the idea being to sample as much of the menu as possible.  The latkes are a standout.

title: Barley Swine
description: Restaurant serving sophisticated dishes made with local produce.  Their seasonal, prix-fixe menu takes away all decision fatigue and allows guests to focus on their dining experience.  Book the kitchen counter to watch the chefs in action.

title: Pici
description: Italian cuisine in Hong Kong's Wan Chai district.  The focus here is on pasta - Pici offers a selection of dishes and flavors.  The pasta is hand-rolled daily and the menu changes weekly.  There are multiple branches throughout the city.

title: Ellerman House
description: Perched on a slope overlooking Bantry Bay, the views from Ellerman House are breathtaking.  The hotel is a unique, elevated lodging experience, but the art collection housed within is among the biggest private collections in the country.

title: St. P√∂lten
description: Capital of Lower Austria and home to a mixture of Baroque and modern architecture.  Popular examples of the former include the cathedral and Rathaus (townhall).  Landtagsschiff, the state parliament building, is a contemporary landmark.

title: Koh Chang
description: Thailand's third-largest island and located near the Cambodian border.  Visited for its forested peaks, waterfalls, expansive bays, and coral reefs.  Koh Chang is a hub for recreation and adventure - from hiking to diving.

title: Torquato Tasso
description: High-energy club and concert hall offering live music in the heart of the city.  Not just for tango, Torquato Tasso also hosts bands - from folkl√≥rico to rock.  Visit for drinks, music, and dancing in good company.

title: Art Sonje Center
description: This contemporary art museum often showcases new artists and interesting mediums, often discussing social issues through the art.  The venue also hosts different events, so be sure to check the website to see what's happening.

title: Curzon Soho
description: This gem in the city's West End is one of the rare cinemas where moviegoers can still enjoy film on 35mm.  They screen both indie and arthouse films, in addition to the latest blockbusters.  The cafe is also a popular people-watching spot.

title: Aman Tokyo
description: Upscale hotel retreat located in the upper floors of a posh high-rise.  The 84 rooms and suites come with their own private furo - a soaking tub that plays a role in Japanese bathing rituals.  More luxury amenities exist throughout.

title: Asmali Cavit
description: For over 20 years, Asmali Cavit has been dishing up stuffed mussels, Black Sea anchovies, and Armenian topik in the city of Istanbul.  The yaprak ciƒüer is also a popular choice - a plate of sliced and fried liver.

title: Curry 36
description: From a wooden wagon to a Berlin institution.  Curry 36 is one of the city's most frequented snack bars, providing patrons with hearty and affordable eats into the early hours.  Currywurst and chips aplenty.

title: Cordon Blue Vietnamese Restaurant
description: Certified hole in the wall.  A compact location but the food served is stellar - from the headline roast chicken to the imperial rolls.  Hearty portions all around.  Refillable tea is a nice touch too.  Cash only.

title: Ham Yard Hotel
description: Part of the Firmdale family, all of the 91 rooms are uniquely designed by award-winning designer Kit Kemp.  The hotel is built around a lush, tree-filled courtyard which makes for great alfresco dining.  There's a bowling alley too üé≥.

title: 28 HongKong Street
description: This secretive speakeasy-style bar serves expertly crafted cocktails made by knowledgeable bar staff.  The food menu features some creative dishes.  For a weekend visit it's best to book ahead.  Aim for the address, there is no signage.

title: Sydney Theatre Company
description: The Sydney Theatre Company now tours all over the world, performing a variety of international and Australian plays.  But if they are in town, live theatre fans will thoroughly enjoy heading to one of their spectacular shows.

title: Travessa do Com√©rcio
description: One of Rio de Janeiro's historic streets.  Walk the cobblestone between a number of preserved sobrados - homes preserved from the Portuguese colonial era.  There are plenty of restaurants  and bars to check out here too.

title: Belgard Kitchen
description: Belgard Kitchen is an upscale-rustic restaurant serving breakfast, lunch, dinner, and weekend brunch.  Expect hearty dishes alongside ample craft beers, ciders, and local wines.  Book ahead if visiting during peak hours.

title: Aachen
description: Historical city where the borders of Germany, Belgium, and the Netherlands meet.  First developed as a natural bathing town in Roman times, Aachen's fame now extends to its UNESCO cathedral, heritage buildings, and young vibe.

title: Babylonstoren Wine Estate
description: Deserving a full day of attention, the Babylonstoren Wine Estate is ideal for foodies and wine fanatics.  The resident hotel perfects understated elegance.  Cultivates 13 types of grape - go for the wine, stay for the spa and gardens.

title: W√§rdshuset Ulla Winbladh
description: Sophisticated restaurant within the namesake hotel.  Offers a beautiful patio area for enjoying a relaxing lunch or dinner.  The menu offers delicious traditional Swedish cuisine like meatballs, herring, and venison.

title: Nauta
description: Prenzlauer Berg's go-to Peruvian spot... with the price to match.  The food is good and it's presented beautifully, but you'll feel like you were out in NYC instead of in Berlin.  Nice ambiance and great bartender.

title: World Erotic Art Museum
description: Boasts an impressive collection of erotic art, housing over 4,000 works by renowned artists like Salvador Dali and Pablo Picasso. The base of the collection are works belonging to Naomi Wilzig, who founded the museum in 2005.

1930 takes the idea of speakeasy secrecy seriously - even Google Maps can't pinpoint its location.  Still, the venue has earned renown, being lauded as one of the world's best.  Track the bar down through word of mouth and enjoy.

title: Hotel Icon
description: Luxury within walking distance of Kowloon's attractions.  An extension of the Hong Kong Polytechnic University‚Äôs hospitality school, Hotel Icon is a five-star venue overlooking Kowloon Bay and Victoria Harbour.

title: Circo Voador
description: Open-air music venue and nightclub.  The perfect place to catch local, and even international, bands on weeknights and weekends.  On Fridays and Saturdays, the venue is packed with music lovers who come for the party vibes and high energy.

title: Avant Comptoir de la Terre
description: Modern tapas bar with a meat-centric menu and an extensive selection of natural wines. Be prepared, this is a standing-only restaurant.
